data.headline: S&P 500 and Nasdaq slipped modestly, pressured by tech sector weakness and rotation out of megacaps
bullets: Dow hovered near record highs, outperforming broader indexes
Russell 2000 remained roughly flat amid choppy, low-volume trading
December retail sales came in unexpectedly flat, raising concerns about economic slowdown
Cooling wage and cost data pushed Treasury yields lower and increased expectations for Fed rate cuts
Hasbro surged on strong earnings, while Coca-Cola slipped
AI-linked tech and software names, including Spotify and Credo, saw notable single-stock moves
Alphabet announced a $30 billion AI-focused bond sale, driving stock-specific action ahead of jobs data
